channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Security Key Lifecycle Manager
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Security Key Lifecycle Manager

item.title: CVE-2017-1727|2024-08-05T13:39:32.274Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, and 2.7 discloses sensitive information in error messages that could aid an attacker in further attacks against the system. IBM X-Force ID: 134869.

item.title: CVE-2018-1738|2024-08-05T04:07:44.358Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Security Key Lifecycle Manager 2.6, 2.7, 3.0 could allow an authenticated user to obtain highly sensitive information or jeopardize system integrity due to improper authentication mechanisms. IBM X-Force ID: 147907.

item.title: CVE-2018-1751|2024-08-05T04:07:44.347Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Security Key Lifecycle Manager 3.0 through 3.0.0.2 uses weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 148512.

item.title: CVE-2017-1672|2024-08-05T13:39:32.233Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.6 and 2.7 is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery which could allow an attacker to execute malicious and unauthorized actions transmitted from a user that the website trusts. IBM X-Force ID: 133639.

item.title: CVE-2018-1744|2024-08-05T04:07:44.307Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Security Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, 2.7, and 3.0 could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 148423.

item.title: CVE-2017-1669|2024-08-05T13:39:31.933Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, and 2.7 stores sensitive information in URL parameters. This may lead to information disclosure if unauthorized parties have access to the URLs via server logs, referrer header or browser history. IBM X-Force ID: 133636.

item.title: CVE-2017-1666|2024-08-05T13:39:32.090Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, and 2.7 is vulnerable to a XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources. IBM X-Force ID: 133540.

item.title: CVE-2017-1665|2024-08-05T13:39:31.897Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, and 2.7 uses weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 133559.

item.title: CVE-2017-1671|2024-08-05T13:39:32.201Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, and 2.7 could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to view arbitrary files on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 133638.

item.title: CVE-2018-1749|2024-08-05T04:07:44.341Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.6, 2.7, and 3.0 uses incomplete blacklisting for input validation which allows attackers to bypass application controls resulting in direct impact to the system and data integrity. IBM X-Force ID: 148484.

item.title: CVE-2018-1745|2024-08-05T04:07:44.313Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Security Key Lifecycle Manager 2.7 and 3.0 could allow an unauthenticated user to restart the SKLM server due to missing authentication. IBM X-Force ID: 148424.

item.title: CVE-2017-1670|2024-08-05T13:39:31.900Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, and 2.7 is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database. IBM X-Force ID: 133637.

item.title: CVE-2017-1673|2024-08-05T13:39:31.666Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, and 2.7 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 133640.

item.title: CVE-2018-1750|2024-08-05T04:07:44.385Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Security Key Lifecycle Manager 3.0 specifies permissions for a security-critical resource in a way that allows that resource to be read or modified by unintended actors. IBM X-Force ID: 148511.

item.title: CVE-2017-1664|2024-08-05T13:39:32.078Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, and 2.7 uses weaker than expected cryptographic algorithms that could allow an attacker to decrypt highly sensitive information. IBM X-Force ID: 133557.

item.title: CVE-2018-1741|2024-08-05T04:07:44.356Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.6, 2.7, and 3.0 does not properly limit the number or frequency of interaction which could be used to cause a denial of service, compromise program logic or other consequences. IBM X-Force ID: 148420.

item.title: CVE-2018-1747|2024-08-05T04:07:44.398Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Security Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, 2.7, and 3.0 is vulnerable to a XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources. IBM X-Force ID: 148428.

item.title: CVE-2017-1668|2024-08-05T13:39:32.040Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.5, 2.6, and 2.7 could allow a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks, using an open redirect attack. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof the URL displayed to redirect a user to a malicious Web site that would appear to be trusted. This could allow the attacker to obtain highly sensitive information or conduct further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 133562.

item.title: CVE-2018-1743|2024-08-05T04:07:44.373Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.6, 2.7, and 3.0 discloses sensitive information to unauthorized users. The information can be used to mount further attacks on the system. IBM X-Force ID: 148422.

item.title: CVE-2018-1753|2024-08-05T04:07:44.360Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.6, 2.7, and 3.0 generates an error message that includes sensitive information about its environment, users, or associated data. IBM X-Force ID: 148514.

item.title: CVE-2018-1742|2024-08-05T04:07:44.327Z -- ibm -- security%20key%20lifecycle%20manager
item.description: IBM Tivoli Key Lifecycle Manager 2.6, 2.7, and 3.0 contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key, which it uses for its own inbound authentication, outbound communication to external components, or encryption of internal data. IBM X-Force ID: 148421.
